passage_text: Average Catering Owner Salaries. The average salary for catering owner jobs is $71,000. Average catering owner salaries can vary greatly due to company, location, industry, experience and benefits. This salary was calculated using the average salary for all jobs with the term catering owner anywhere in the job listing.

In the state of Illinois, the average catering employee salary is just $39,732 a year. In New York, a city with not only a higher cost of living but also a reputation for great food, the average salary jumps up almost $10,000 to $46,046, and even higher in New Jersey at $51,492.

The average salary for catering owner jobs is $71,000. Average catering owner salaries can vary greatly due to company, location, industry, experience and benefits. This salary was calculated using the average salary for all jobs with the term catering owner anywhere in the job listing.

For example the median expected annual pay for a typical Catering Manager in the United States is $44,724 so 50% of the people who perform the job of Catering Manager in the United States are expected to make less than $44,724.

Expected Lifetime Earnings: $1,837,000. Most average caterers can make between $32,000 and $75,000 a year. Those numbers reflect a pretty wide salary spectrum. The amount of money you earn depends on a number of variables. First: location, location, location.
